intro: Diapensia purpurea f. albida, commonly known as the white-flowered rockfoam, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, contrasting with its dark green, hairy leaves. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
